description: Yiddish שמיר‎ (shmir, “smear, spread”); cognate with German schmieren and English smear.

entries.meaning: A spread that goes on a bagel.
A batch of things that go together.
examples: So you can buy a la carte programming, or you can buy the whole schmear.

verbs.description: schmear (third-person singular simple present schmears, present participle schmearing, simple past and past participle schmeared)

entries.meaning: To spread something, often a bagel spread.

examples: "What happened?""Nothing.""How could nothing happen if you're not with her? Listen, did you grease that d.j.?""No.""You didn't schmear him? You think the world owes you a living?"
